summary: 67 of 251 military personnel with CAP were classified into the Adv group. 134 were classified into the non-Adv group and 50 were classified into the unknown pathogen group. the patients in the Adv group had a longer duration of fever after admission. the Adv group more commonly had no response or exhibited adverse events after antipyretic treatment compared to the Non-Adv group. the time from admission to overall clinical stabilization was significantly longer in the patients in the Adv group than in those in the Non-Adv group.
